title: Tabular Manifest
text: consulting company, Melinae, frequently assists clients large datasets consisting many variables varying quality. can develop sophisticated statistical models provide client insight competitive advantage, first learn characteristics existing datasets. package provides tools assist initial exploration real-world datasets. Although tools substitute thoughtful inspection later analyses, make exploration time efficient. tools allow us quickly start developing innovative solutions delivering results. idea behind R package configuring metadata quicker robust coding repetitive code. company benefited many tools developed community, ’d like contribute back. Suggestions, criticisms, code contributions welcome. developer interested trying direction suits better, ’ll happy explain package’s internals help fork version. starting material described documentation--developers/ directory. Thanks, Melinae Analytics Team Jim Quallen Beasley organization interested consulting services Melinae, please contact Jim Quallen jim@melinae.com. question package, please consider starting new issue.

title: Tabular Manifest — TabularManifest-package
code: create_manifest_explore_univariate(datasets::InsectSprays, write_to_disk=FALSE) #>   variable_name remark   class should_graph       graph_function x_label_format #> 1         count        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous  scales::comma #> 2         spray         factor         TRUE   histogram_discrete  scales::comma #>   bin_width bin_start rounding_digits #> 1         1         0               1 #> 2         1         1               1  if( require(grDevices) ) {   histogram_continuous(d_observed=beaver1, variable_name="temp", bin_width=.1)   histogram_discrete(d_observed=infert, variable_name="age") }

what: Internal function for creating default bins for dataset variables. — calculate_bins
title: Internal function for creating default bins for dataset variables. — calculate_bins
text: internal function (ie, currently exposed/exported outside package) creating default bins dataset variables.

title: Internal function for creating default bins for dataset variables. — calculate_bins
code: calculate_bins(d_observed, bin_count_suggestion = 30L)

title: Internal function for creating default bins for dataset variables. — calculate_bins
text: d_observed data.frame columns calculate bins. bin_count_suggestion integer numeric value suggested number bins variable.

title: Internal function for creating default bins for dataset variables. — calculate_bins
text: Returns list, two elements.  element array many values columns d_observed. bin_width variable name (d_observed). bin_start variable's class. (eg, numeric, Date, factor)

title: Internal function for calculating rounding digits for dataset variables — calculate_rounding_digits
code: calculate_rounding_digits(d_observed=freeny) #> [1] 1 6 6 6 6 calculate_rounding_digits(d_observed=InsectSprays) #> [1] 1 1 calculate_rounding_digits(d_observed=beaver1) #> [1] 4 4 4 4

what: Construct a graph or list of graphs — construct_graph
title: Construct a graph or list of graphs — construct_graph
text: Construct graph list graphs, whose characteristics determined configuration file.

title: Construct a graph or list of graphs — construct_graph
code: construct_graph_univariate(variable_name, ds_metadata, d_observed)

title: Construct a graph or list of graphs — construct_graph
text: variable_name name single variable graph. ds_metadata data.frame containing metadata. See create_manifest_explore_univariate. d_observed data.frame containing data graphed.

title: Construct a graph or list of graphs — construct_graph
code: #d_observed <- beaver1 d_observed <- InsectSprays ds_manifest <- TabularManifest::create_manifest_explore_univariate(d_observed, write_to_disk=FALSE)  construct_graph_univariate(variable_name="count", ds_manifest, InsectSprays) #> $variable_name #> [1] "count" #>  #> $graph  #>  #> $remark #> [1] "" #>   construct_graph_list_univariate(ds_manifest=ds_manifest, d_observed=d_observed) #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$variable_name #> [1] "count" #>  #> [[1]]$graph  #>  #> [[1]]$remark #> [1] "" #>  #>  #> [[2]] #> [[2]]$variable_name #> [1] "spray" #>  #> [[2]]$graph  #>  #> [[2]]$remark #> [1] "" #>  #>

what: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
title: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
text: function creates meta-dataset (data.frame passed parameter) optionally saves meta-dataset CSV.  meta-dataset specifies variables plotted.

title: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
code: create_manifest_explore_univariate(   d_observed,   write_to_disk = TRUE,   path_out = getwd(),   overwrite_file = FALSE,   default_class_graph = c(numeric = "histogram_continuous", integer =     "histogram_continuous", factor = "histogram_discrete", character =     "histogram_discrete", notMatched = "histogram_generic"),   default_format = c(numeric = "scales::comma", notMatched = "scales::comma"),   bin_count_suggestion = 30L )

title: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
text: d_observed data.frame create metadata . write_to_disk Indicates meta-dataset saved CSV. path_out file path save meta-dataset. overwrite_file Indicates CSV meta-dataset overwritten file already exists location. default_class_graph character array indicating graph used variables certain class. default_format character array indicating formatting function displayed axis univariate graph. bin_count_suggestion integer value number roughly number bins desired histogram.

title: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
text: Returns data.frame row metadata represents column d_observed. metadata contains following columns variable_name variable name (d_observed). character. remark blank field allows theuser enter notes CSV later reference. class variable's class (eg, numeric, Date, factor).  character. should_graph boolean value indicating variable graphed. logical. graph_function name function used graph variable. character. x_label_format name function used format x-axis. character. bin_width uniform width bins. numeric. bin_start location left boundary first bin. numeric.

title: Create a manifest for exploring univariate patterns. — create_manifest_explore_univariate
code: create_manifest_explore_univariate(datasets::InsectSprays, write_to_disk=FALSE) #>   variable_name remark   class should_graph       graph_function x_label_format #> 1         count        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous  scales::comma #> 2         spray         factor         TRUE   histogram_discrete  scales::comma #>   bin_width bin_start rounding_digits #> 1         1         0               1 #> 2         1         1               1  #Careful, the first column is a `ts` class. create_manifest_explore_univariate(datasets::freeny, write_to_disk=FALSE) #>           variable_name remark   class should_graph       graph_function #> 1                     y             ts         TRUE    histogram_generic #> 2 lag.quarterly.revenue        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous #> 3           price.index        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous #> 4          income.level        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous #> 5      market.potential        numeric         TRUE histogram_continuous #>   x_label_format bin_width bin_start rounding_digits #> 1  scales::comma     1.000     1.000               1 #> 2  scales::comma     0.050     8.750               6 #> 3  scales::comma     0.020     4.260               6 #> 4  scales::comma     0.010     5.820               6 #> 5  scales::comma     0.005    12.965               6

what: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
title: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
text: Generate histogram numeric integer variable.  graph intended quickly provide researcher quick, yet thorough representation continuous variable.  additional annotations may desired publication-quality plots.

title: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
code: histogram_continuous(   d_observed,   variable_name,   bin_width = NULL,   main_title = base::gsub("_", " ", variable_name, perl = TRUE),   sub_title = NULL,   caption = paste0("each bin is ", scales::comma(bin_width), " units wide"),   x_title = variable_name,   y_title = "Frequency",   x_axis_format = scales::comma_format(),   rounded_digits = 0L,   font_base_size = 12 )

title: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
text: d_observed data.frame variable graph. variable_name name variable graph. character. bin_width width histogram bins. NULL, ggplot2 default used. numeric. main_title desired title top graph.  Defaults variable_name, underscores replaced spaces. title desired, pass value NULL. character. sub_title desired subtitle near top graph.  Defaults NULL subtitle desired, pass value NULL. character. caption desired text bottom-right, axis.  Defaults bin_width. caption desired, pass value NULL. character. x_title desired title x-axis.  Defaults variable_name.  axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. y_title desired title y-axis.  Defaults “Frequency”. axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. x_axis_format x-axis digits formatted. Defaults scales::comma_format().  scale format. rounded_digits number decimals show mean median annotations. character. font_base_size Sets font size ggplot2's theme.

title: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
text: Returns histogram ggplot2 object.

title: Generate a Histogram for a numeric or integer variable. — histogram_continuous
code: library(datasets) #Don't run graphs on a headless machine without any the basic graphics packages installed. if (require(grDevices)) {   # Simple Case   histogram_continuous(     d_observed = beaver1,     variable_name  = "temp",     bin_width      = .1,     rounded_digits = 2    )    # Variable has no nonmissing values   histogram_continuous(     d_observed     = beaver1[integer(0), ],     variable_name  = "temp",     bin_width      = .1,     rounded_digits = 2   )    # Adjust cosmetics of histogram   histogram_continuous(     d_observed         = beaver1,     variable_name      = "temp",     bin_width          = .1,     rounded_digits     = 2,     x_axis_format      = scales::comma_format(),     y_title            = "Count of 10-min Measurements"   ) }

what: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
title: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
text: Generate histogram date variable.  graph intended quickly provide researcher quick, yet thorough representation date.  additional annotations may desired publication-quality plots.

title: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
code: histogram_date(   d_observed,   variable_name,   bin_unit = c("day", "week", "month", "quarter", "year"),   main_title = base::gsub("_", " ", variable_name, perl = TRUE),   sub_title = NULL,   caption = paste0("each bin is 1 ", bin_unit, " wide"),   x_title = variable_name,   y_title = "Frequency",   x_axis_format = scales::comma_format(),   font_base_size = 12 )

title: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
text: d_observed data.frame variable graph. variable_name name variable graph. character. bin_unit width histogram bins. Value passed base::seq.Date(). Defaults 'day'. numeric. main_title desired title top graph.  Defaults variable_name, underscores replaced spaces. title desired, pass value NULL. character. sub_title desired subtitle near top graph.  Defaults NULL subtitle desired, pass value NULL. character. caption desired text bottom-right, axis.  Defaults bin_width. caption desired, pass value NULL. character. x_title desired title x-axis.  Defaults variable_name.  axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. y_title desired title y-axis.  Defaults “Frequency”. axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. x_axis_format x-axis digits formatted. Defaults scales::comma_format().  scale format. font_base_size Sets font size ggplot2's theme.

title: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
text: Returns histogram ggplot2 object.

title: Generate a Histogram for a date variable. — histogram_date
code: # Don't run graphs on a headless machine without any the basic graphics packages installed. if( require(grDevices) & require(nycflights13) ) {   ds               <- nycflights13::flights   ds$date_depart   <- as.Date(ISOdate(ds$year, ds$month, ds$day))   ds$date_blank    <- as.Date(NA)    histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="day")   histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="week")   histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="month")   histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="quarter")   histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="year")    histogram_date(ds, variable_name="date_depart", bin_unit="day") } #> Loading required package: nycflights13

what: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
title: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
text: Generate histogram character factor variable.  graph intended quickly provide researcher quick, yet thorough representation continuous variable.  additional annotations may desired publication-quality plots.

title: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
code: histogram_discrete(   d_observed,   variable_name,   levels_to_exclude = character(0),   main_title = base::gsub("_", " ", variable_name, perl = TRUE),   x_title = NULL,   y_title = "Number of Included Records",   text_size_percentage = 6,   bin_width = 1L,   font_base_size = 12 )

title: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
text: d_observed data.frame variable graph. variable_name name variable graph. character. levels_to_exclude array levels excluded histogram. Pass empty variable (ie, character(0)) levels desired; default. character. main_title desired title top graph.  Defaults variable_name, underscores replaced spaces. title desired, pass value NULL. character. x_title desired title x-axis.  Defaults number included records. axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. y_title desired title y-axis.  Defaults “Frequency”. axis title desired, pass value NULL. character. text_size_percentage size percentage values top bars. character. bin_width (parameter included compatibility graphing functions.  always 1 discrete boolean variables.) font_base_size Sets font size ggplot2's theme.

title: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
text: Returns histogram ggplot2 object.

title: Generate a Histogram for a character or factor variable. — histogram_discrete
code: ds <-   datasets::infert |>    tibble::as_tibble()    # Simulate missing values ds$education[c(3:9, 20:29, 80:95)] <- NA ds$age[      c(5:8, 14:22, 70:85)] <- NA     # Don't run graphs on a headless machine without any the basic graphics packages installed. if( require(grDevices) ) {   # Simple Cases   histogram_discrete(     d_observed     = ds,      variable_name  = "education"   )   histogram_discrete(     d_observed     = ds,      variable_name  = "age"   )      # Variable has no nonmissing values   histogram_discrete(     d_observed     = ds[100:200, ],      variable_name  = "age"   )    # Adjust cosmetics of bar-graph/histogram   histogram_discrete(     d_observed         = ds,      variable_name      = "age",     levels_to_exclude  = c(21:29, 40:44),    # Show only subjects in their 30s.     main_title         = "Frequency of Subjects, by Age"   ) }

what: Internal function for examining a logit performance — scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit
title: Internal function for examining a logit performance — scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit
text: Internal function examining logit performance

title: Internal function for examining a logit performance — scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit
code: scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit(   d_plot,   x_name,   y_name = "y",   yhat_name = "yhat",   residual_name = "residual",   alpha_point = 0.05,   alpha_se_band = 0.15,   x_label_format = scales::comma,   color_smooth_observed = "#1b9e77",   color_smooth_predicted = "#d95f02",   color_smooth_residual = "#7570b3",   vertical_limits = c(-0.05, 1.05),   jitter_observed = ggplot2::position_jitter(w = 0, h = 0.2),   jitter_predicted = ggplot2::position_jitter(w = 0, h = 0),   seed_value = NA_real_ )

title: Internal function for examining a logit performance — scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit
text: d_plot data.frame observed predicted values plot. x_name name predictor character. y_name name observed response character. yhat_name name predicted response character. residual_name name model residual. character. alpha_point transparency plotted point. numeric value 0 1. alpha_se_band transparency standard error bands. numeric value 0 1. x_label_format name function used format x-axis. character. color_smooth_observed plotted color observed values' GAM trend.  character. color_smooth_predicted plotted color predicted's GAM trend.  character. color_smooth_residual plotted color residual's GAM trend.  character. vertical_limits plotted limits response variable. two-element numeric array. jitter_observed function dictating observed values jittered. jitter_predicted function dictating predicted values jittered. seed_value value RNG seed, affects jittering. seed set value NA passed.  numeric.

title: Internal function for examining a logit performance — scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit
code: ds <-   mtcars |>   dplyr::mutate(     # am  = as.logical(am)   ) |>   dplyr::select(     mpg,     am,   ) |>   tibble::rownames_to_column("model")  # scatter_model_continuous_x_binary_y_logit( #   d_plot = ds, #   x_name = "mpg", #   y_name = "am", #   yhat_name = NULL # )

what: Trim extreme quantiles from a variable. — univariate_trim
title: Trim extreme quantiles from a variable. — univariate_trim
text: Replaces extreme values NA values.

title: Trim extreme quantiles from a variable. — univariate_trim
code: univariate_trim(scores, quantile_lower = 0, quantile_upper = 1)

title: Trim extreme quantiles from a variable. — univariate_trim
text: scores vector values quantile() can accept. quantile_lower lower inclusive bound values retain. quantile_upper upper inclusive bound values retain.

title: Trim extreme quantiles from a variable. — univariate_trim
text: Returns vector class scores.
